alert.note: Alert for Denali (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 13 at 3:53AM AKDT until May 16 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCHES ARE IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 223, 225 AND 226... Strong winds combined with low relative humidity near 25 percent are possible for Delta Junction South and in the Alaska Range beginning Sunday morning and continuing into Monday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS FOR DENALI... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Fire Weather Watch for Strong winds, which is in effect from Sunday morning through Monday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Denali. * TIMING...10 AM Sunday to 12 AM Monday night. * WINDS...South 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 40s to low 50s. * IMPACTS...Rapid Ignition, growth and spread of fires are possible.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that weather conditions could lead to the potential for a Red Flag event in the near future. This watch will remain in effect until it is upgraded to a Red Flag Warning or that it is determined that the Red Flag event will not develop. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
